info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 1:57PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Schenectady and central Albany Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 156 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Berne, or 11 miles west of Delmar, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Albany, Schenectady, Rotterdam, Colonie, Scotia, Guilderland, Westerlo, Berne, Voorheesville, Altamont, Loudonville, New Scotland, Knox, Clarksville, Shakers, East Berne, Gifford, Karlsfeld, Schonowe and Bramans Corners. This includes the following highways... Interstate 88 near exit 25. Interstate 90 between exits 4 and 26. Interstate 890 between exits 1b and 9. Interstate 87 between exits 24 and 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
